column4: correct. Removeing a package via package manager will NOT NOT NOT touch the stuff in the users home dirs..
does a search on the calculated md5sum return anything?
checking other places for the md5sums now..
even weirder. torrent client verified it as being ok.. but the md5sums are not matching from /dev/cdrom or from the iso file. with what i see on 2 different ubuntu sites.
i can only think that the shipit cd has some extra zero padding at the end, causing the mismatch.
yea.  may of been when i dd'd it..  the other iso's i downloaded to match.
well i will red5sum the torrent one now. :)
This guy said he had to enable ahci in bios: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1528398
ok.. - im reorganising some stuff and will try that. In 'theory' an external eSata should be as fast as an internal hd right?
should be same as sata 1.5 if i understand it
odd.. ive never noticed that issue with using grub2 to boot ISO files.
